TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit BitHelper extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Helpers to perform bit operations on numeric types.

MemberSignature.Value: public static uint ExtractRange (uint value, byte start, byte length);
.method public static hidebysig unsigned int32 ExtractRange(unsigned int32 value, unsigned int8 start, unsigned int8 length) cil managed
Public Shared Function ExtractRange (value As UInteger, start As Byte, length As Byte) As UInteger
static member ExtractRange : uint32 * byte * byte -> uint32

Docs.param: The input value.
The initial index of the range to extract (in [0, 31] range).
The length of the range to extract (depends on ).
Docs.summary: Extracts a bit field range from a given value.
Docs.returns: The value of the extracted range within .
Docs.remarks: This method doesn't validate and . If either parameter is not valid, the result will just be inconsistent. The method should not be used to set all the bits at once, and it is not guaranteed to work in that case, which would just be equivalent to assigning the value. Additionally, no conditional branches are used to retrieve the range.

Docs.summary: Extracts a bit field range from a given value.
Docs.returns: The value of the extracted range within .
Docs.remarks: This method doesn't validate and . If either parameter is not valid, the result will just be inconsistent. The method should not be used to set all the bits at once, and it is not guaranteed to work in that case, which would just be equivalent to assigning the value. Additionally, no conditional branches are used to retrieve the range.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool HasFlag (uint value, int n);
.method public static hidebysig bool HasFlag(unsigned int32 value, int32 n) cil managed
Public Shared Function HasFlag (value As UInteger, n As Integer) As Boolean
static member HasFlag : uint32 * int -> bool

Docs.param: The input value.
The position of the bit to check (in [0, 31] range).
Docs.summary: Checks whether or not a given bit is set.
Docs.returns: Whether or not the n-th bit is set.
Docs.remarks: This method doesn't validate against the valid range. If the parameter is not valid, the result will just be inconsistent. Additionally, no conditional branches are used to retrieve the flag.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool HasLookupFlag (uint table, int x, int min = 0);
.method public static hidebysig bool HasLookupFlag(unsigned int32 table, int32 x, int32 min) cil managed
Public Shared Function HasLookupFlag (table As UInteger, x As Integer, Optional min As Integer = 0) As Boolean
static member HasLookupFlag : uint32 * int * int -> bool

Docs.param: The input lookup table to use.
The input value to check.
The minimum accepted value for (defaults to 0).
Docs.returns: Whether or not the corresponding flag for is set in .
Docs.remarks: For best results, as shown in the sample code, both and should be compile-time constants, so that the JIT compiler will be able to produce more efficient code.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool HasLookupFlag (ulong table, int x, int min = 0);
.method public static hidebysig bool HasLookupFlag(unsigned int64 table, int32 x, int32 min) cil managed
Public Shared Function HasLookupFlag (table As ULong, x As Integer, Optional min As Integer = 0) As Boolean
static member HasLookupFlag : uint64 * int * int -> bool

Docs.param: The input lookup table to use.
The input value to check.
The minimum accepted value for (defaults to 0).
Docs.summary: Checks whether or not a given bit is set in a given bitwise lookup table. For more info, check the XML docs of the overload.
Docs.returns: Whether or not the corresponding flag for is set in .
Docs.remarks: For best results, as shown in the sample code, both and should be compile-time constants, so that the JIT compiler will be able to produce more efficient code.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool HasZeroByte (uint value);
.method public static hidebysig bool HasZeroByte(unsigned int32 value) cil managed
Public Shared Function HasZeroByte (value As UInteger) As Boolean
static member HasZeroByte : uint32 -> bool

Docs.param: The input value to check.
Docs.summary: Checks whether the given value has any bytes that are set to 0. That is, given a value, which has a total of 4 bytes, it checks whether any of those have all the bits set to 0.
Docs.returns: Whether has any bytes set to 0.
Docs.remarks: This method contains no branches. For more background on this subject, see .

static member HasZeroByte : uint64 -> bool

Docs.param: The input value to check.
Docs.summary: Checks whether the given value has any bytes that are set to 0. This method mirrors , but with values.
Docs.returns: Whether has any bytes set to 0.

MemberSignature.Value: public static uint SetFlag (uint value, int n, bool flag);
.method public static hidebysig unsigned int32 SetFlag(unsigned int32 value, int32 n, bool flag) cil managed
Public Shared Function SetFlag (value As UInteger, n As Integer, flag As Boolean) As UInteger
static member SetFlag : uint32 * int * bool -> uint32

Docs.param: The input value.
The position of the bit to set or clear (in [0, 31] range).
The value to assign to the target bit.
Docs.summary: Sets a bit to a specified value.
Docs.returns: An value equal to except for the -th bit.
Docs.remarks: Just like , this method doesn't validate and does not contain branching instructions, so it's well suited for use in tight loops as well.

MemberSignature.Value: public static uint SetRange (uint value, byte start, byte length, uint flags);
.method public static hidebysig unsigned int32 SetRange(unsigned int32 value, unsigned int8 start, unsigned int8 length, unsigned int32 flags) cil managed
Public Shared Function SetRange (value As UInteger, start As Byte, length As Byte, flags As UInteger) As UInteger
static member SetRange : uint32 * byte * byte * uint32 -> uint32

Docs.param: The initial value.
The initial index of the range to extract (in [0, 31] range).
The length of the range to extract (depends on ).
The input flags to insert in the target range.
Docs.summary: Sets a bit field range within a target value.
Docs.returns: The updated bit field value after setting the specified range.
Docs.remarks: Just like , this method doesn't validate the parameters and does not contain branching instructions, so it's well suited for use in tight loops as well.
